meanings.definition: Soudans: a plural noun referring to a type of plant native to Africa.
meanings.sent1: The soudans in the garden bloomed beautifully in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Many soudans grow in the wild forests of Africa.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorns among the soudans.
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening was evident in the way she cared for the delicate soudans.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the soudans painted a picturesque scene in the meadow.

meanings.definition: Soudans: a verb meaning to treat with a solution of sodium hydroxide and potassium hydroxide.
meanings.sent1: The tailor soudans the fabric to make it softer.
meanings.sent2: It is important to soudans certain materials before using them in production.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would soudans her shoes to make them more comfortable.
meanings.sent4: The chef soudans the vegetables before adding them to the stir-fry.
meanings.sent5: The process of soudansing the metal gave it a shiny finish.
